name.description: Required. Unique ID of the broadcast template used internally.

title.description: Required. The title of the notification. This will also be used as the subject if the notification is an email.

body.description: Required. The body of the notification represented as a mix of custom-made elements. An element can be a text, image or button.

type.description: Required. The type of notification. If [visible] is true, it will also be shown in the notification dashboard.

visible.description: Whether this notification is visible in the user's notification dashboard. Defaults to `true`.

highPriority.description: Whether this message is high priority or not. Use this flag only in cases of very important messages such as suspicious activity or security breaches. Defaults to `false`.

ttl.description: Time to live. How many days this will be visible in the notification dashboard before it expires. Not applicable if [visible] is false. If set to null or 0, it will be indefinite. Defaults to 30 days.

text.description: As a text element, this will display a simple text body.

internalMedia.description: As a media element, this will point to an internal media file situated on the current server. eg. `smile.png`.

externalMedia.description: As a media element, this will point to an external media file situated on an external server. eg. `https://giphy.com/gifs/wwe-wrestling-l0HUg6Ypas42ubkXu`.
